page.title: 08River Kennet_Creatures
page.content: The river contains many kinds of{fish, such as carp, trout and salmon. There are also smaller creatures like shrimps, tadpoles, newts, and frogs. Local children often play near the river and fish in it in the season. In the spring swans can be seen nesting on the banks and gliding on the water. A moorhen's nest can sometimes be spotted, too. In summer parts of the river dry up. {Fish}become stranded in mud and pools. At this time children enjoy building dams of mud, stones, bricks and weeds. Two or three times a year men from the water board come to cut the weeds growing in the water, to stop it getting clogged up.
